alert.note: Alert for Clay (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:20PM CDT until April 21 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee affecting Clay County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Mississippi... Noxubee River At Macon affecting Noxubee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Flood water is covering the gravel road south of West Point that leads to the Tibbee Creek bridge near Tibbee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CDT Monday was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.7 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Tibbee Creek Tibbee 23.0 23.5 Mon 8 pm CDT 23.7 22.4 18.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CDT.
